intro: Cryptocarya lyoniifolia, commonly known as the Lyoniifolia cryptocarya, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to eastern Australia, particularly Queensland and New South Wales. The plant is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves that are typically dark green and have a leathery texture. It produces small, fragrant white flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by dark blue, spherical berries. Cryptocarya lyoniifolia is often found in rainforest and littoral rainforest habitats, growing as an understory plant.
